title: ChampionShip Shyvana
body: Someone now if chapionship shyvana will be restore ?

replies.body: She's a legacy skin and will be temporarily available in the store during and after Finals. :]
Will there be a bundle with all of the Championship skins besides Riven? or will there only be the bundle with Kalista, the ward and the Icon?
Nothing has been announced yet, and likely won't be until we get closer to Worlds.

Since Worlds is less than a week away now, is it safe to assume that Championship Shyvana will be re-released at the beginning of Worlds (in a week) just like how CS Thresh was pulled out from the vault at the start of Worlds (1st day if I remember correctly)?
Yup! She's available now!
How long are they available for?
Through November 5th.
Now if only Riven were there ;)
K, ty for reply :D
What about this year? Or does Riot do this every year?
Championship skins do come back, and will return this year. We're also bringing back Championship Riven!
Is Riven gonna be on sale too? :D :D :D
Championship Riven is not available at this time.
Why what makes her different?

She's labeled as a 'limited' skin, as opposed to 'legacy'. 

Legacy skins are any skins that were made available temporarily and then retired to the "Legacy Vault." They may be available for normal purchase again at a later date. However, all Legacy Skins above 520RP are available through Mystery Gifting. These skins only appear in the champion's information tab if you own them.

Limited Edition skins are skins that were temporarily available in the store during seasonal or special events then removed once the event was over. These skins cannot be mystery gifted and only appear in the champion's information tab if you own them.

Thats a weird distinction since they're all championship skins but ok.

Also gotta say what you call limited edition skins are something I really don't like as I missed out on quite a bit being a newer player. 

The victorious skins come to mind I find it weird that you don't offer them for a price to players who reach gold but i'm just saying that as someone who really has fallen for elise. Maybe in the future you guys should do more stuff like the first strike portraits to make something special for the time, rather than whole skins that you can just never get if you haven't been playing for 4 years...

> Maybe in the future you guys should do more stuff like the first strike portraits to make something special for the time, rather than whole skins that you can just never get if you haven't been playing for 4 years...

Through the years, we've realized there haven't been many opportunities for newer players to have limited content. We're looking into better ways to help newer players earn a special collection as well. Most recently, we rolled out First Strike for the PROJECT skins, where if you purchased a PROJECT skin during the first week, you unlocked a custom loading screen that players who later bought the skins wouldn't be able to unlock. 

This is something we're absolutely open to exploring again in the future.

Victorious skins have been debated, both internally and on the boards, Reddit. I can see points on both sides. TL;DR, while it's really cool to be a new player and have an opportunity to have Victorious Janna (I'm sad I don't have that one, myself. :P), it's a less than great feeling for a player who grinded through the season to earn the skin. This is one is a bit harder to solve to make both parties happy, since players have already earned the skins, as opposed to everyone beginning from the same point as First Strike. These are also achievement skins, as opposed to content that could be purchased with RP.
I'm kind of surprised that getting gold in one season doesn't grant you the past victorious skins.
Each year's Victorious skin is sort of like a trophy - you earn it for being Gold or higher in a particular season, which is why we don't unlock previous year's Victorious skins.

Have you ever thought about making them available BUT give those who have them now special borders? Like the project borders? And not just give them away ( the old skins ) but make them available in the store or something? It feels weird thinking that "you can't have this because you didn't know about league" kind of thing. Not saying that is what you guys are thinking at all. But it feels awkward not being able to get skins because you didn't know about the game at the time the came out ( or other reasons, not old enough, didn't have a pc, so on )
I love {{champion:25}} & {{champion:60}} and all of their skins, but I wasn't playing when they got their victorious skins ( I don't think I was... Idk man i'm old ok, I forget things )

As Sukishoo mentioned below, there were surveys sent out, and we did have many discussions around the accessibility of these skins, and what that meant for players who earned the skins and for players who missed out on a particular season. 

Again, since they're achievements for a particular season, there was a lot of negative feedback when it came to letting a player who hit Gold+ select the one they wanted, or handing another season's Victorious skin out. 

Borders are great for skins that have an RP value and are available in the shop, and were actually implemented to help newer players (and those who are collectors) obtain limited content and have something a bit more exclusive. :) Prior to these, only OG players had super limited skins, like Urf the Manatee or Championship Riven.


At this time, the verdict is that we don't plan to change how players can obtain the skins.

BUT MOOOOOM
No I can totally understand why. I figured I would ask to get a definitive answer. Sometimes one person says no, someone else says maybe, so I wanted to make sure there was a for sure no. Even then things change so wanted to keep up to date.
Thanks for answering too!
Of course, no harm in asking! Things can change, and an old post may not be what the current deal is. :) I'd rather reply with 'hey, nothing's changed', as opposed nothing and keep people wondering!

They had a survey and posts  about such a thing once and it had so much negative feedback that I highly doubt that will happen. Those skins are made as an Achievement after all, so people that got them, like me having Morgana's, would feel a bit cheated if others got them in another season by just having to buy it or something.

I prob should have been more specific. Anybody below gold ( or plat even ) couldn't buy them. So you still have to get to the required place, but you have to buy them instead of getting them as a reward.

Oh, well they had that option in there too and still not a lot of people liked it.  I'd love it but then it would have still felt like cheating others out of what they earned say the year before (ect).

Yeah I get that you might not want to go back on that with victorious skins. If you did consider it though you could give the people who earned the skin that season a nice gold first strike type border on the splash or something to indicate they didn't just get gold but got it back in s3 or whatever it was. Idk maybe that wouldn't be satisfactory to the people who earned those skins but it seems like a nice middle ground to me
this autumn i think
